intro: Crepis exilis, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, hairy leaves and produces numerous tiny yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Crepis exilis is often used in ecological studies due to its role in supporting pollinators and its adaptability to various environments.
